Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that holds the game logic and the 3x3 matrix for TicTacToe
    Author:
    Kyle Levy

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[][] board
      2D array of integers (0 = empty, 1 = X, 2 = O)
      private boolean gameOver
      If the game is still in progress
      private boolean scratch
      Determines if the board is full with no winner
      private int winner
      The value that corresponds to which player won.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Creates a 3x3 2D array of integers with values all set to 0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void checkScratch()
      Checks if the board is full of non-zero values
      void checkWinner(int playerNum)
      Checks all possibilities for a player to win
      boolean getGameOver()
      Gets game over status.
      boolean makeMove(int boxIndex, int piece)
      Attempts to fill a box with either an X(1) or an O(2)
      void printIndex()
      Prints the 'tutorial' for how to play TicTacToe in the console
      void printWinner()
      Prints the winner of the match if someone has won/scratched
      java.lang.String toString()
      Prints the current status of the board.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • board

        private int[][] board
        2D array of integers (0 = empty, 1 = X, 2 = O)

      • winner

        private int winner
        The value that corresponds to which player won. 0 is game in progress, 1 is X, 2 is 0, and 3 is a scratch.

      • gameOver

        private boolean gameOver
        If the game is still in progress

      • scratch

        private boolean scratch
        Determines if the board is full with no winner

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Creates a 3x3 2D array of integers with values all set to 0

    • Method Detail

      • makeMove

        public boolean makeMove(int boxIndex,
                        int piece)
        Attempts to fill a box with either an X(1) or an O(2)
        Parameters:
        boxIndex - Index number of box
        piece - X = 1: O = 2
        Returns:
        If the index was filled with an X or O, return true. If unsuccessful, return false.

      • checkWinner

        public void checkWinner(int playerNum)
        Checks all possibilities for a player to win
        Parameters:
        playerNum - The number of the player who just made a move

      • printWinner

        public void printWinner()
        Prints the winner of the match if someone has won/scratched

      • checkScratch

        private void checkScratch()
        Checks if the board is full of non-zero values

      • printIndex

        public void printIndex()
        Prints the 'tutorial' for how to play TicTacToe in the console

      • getGameOver

        public boolean getGameOver()
        Gets game over status.
        Returns:
        Returns game over status.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints the current status of the board.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Current status of the board.
